message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.io.*;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class FileParsing {
    public static void read(String filename) throws IOException {
        BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(filename));
        String s;
        while((s = in.readLine())!= null) {
            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(s, ",");
            while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                String token = st.nextToken();
                // process token as needed
                System.out.println(token);
            }
        }
        in.close();
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        read("C:\\Users\\Bogdi\\Desktop\\example.txt");
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we use the StringTokenizer class to break each line of the file into tokens, using the comma as a delimiter. The nextToken() method is used to get each token in turn. You can then process each token as needed. In this example, we simply print each token to the console.
